comments.text:
Created attachment 563465
thunderbird_7_bug_dates_note_time_missing_marker.PNG

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.835.186 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

I've been using TB 2.x and I'm playing with TB 7.0 today. I have old mail in an IMAP server and pulled the headers (and the message) down.


Actual results:

The email shows up as having a date of "today" in the inbox pane by only showing a time (of 10:10am which was around the time the new version was setup).

When opening the mail, the mail view does NOT show a date or time, see attached screenshot.

The messages pulled down has a (date/time) field "Received:", there is no other date field. The "Received:" head is long and spans lines (with a semi colon before the newline).

E.g.

Received: from 11.222.333.44 ([11.222.333.44]) by aaaaaaaaaaaa.bbbbbb.ccc.prv ([11.222.333.55]) with Microsoft Exchange Server HTTP-DAV ;
 Mon,  7 Sep 2009 17:46:53 +0000

NOTE a newline after ";" and a single leading space before the "Mon" of the date.

(IP and addresses hidden, I can email the entire 2Kb file if that would be helpful)



Expected results:

I was expecting to see: 2009-09-07 17:46:53 (and timezone stuff)

comments.text:
I think the ; and newline is valid, I also have such messages in my inbox.
I notice that in the message list pane, TB shows the date/time from the "From - " line (when the message was received). If you enable the "Received" column, there it uses the date/time from the "Received:" field of the message. When I display the full message, there is no date displayed, as you report. I assume there should be the value from the "Date:" filed of the message. But the sender didn't send any, I think it has a bug.
